column5: * Indexes up: Dow 0.42 pct  S&P 0.27 pct  Nasdaq 0.05 pct   (Updates to market open; adds data  quote)

column5: * Futures up: Dow 33 pts  S&P 3 pts  Nasdaq 4.25 pts   (Adds data  updates prices)

column4: Family Dollar rejects Dollar General offer on antitrust worries
column5: Aug 21 Family Dollar Stores Inc rejected Dollar General Corp's  acquisition offer  citing antitrust concerns  and reaffirmed its support for a buyout offer from Dollar Tree Inc.

column4: Dollar General questions motives of Family Dollar CEO
column5: Dollar General Corp  questioned whether Family Dollar Stores Inc  Chief Executive Howard Levine was being driven by self-interest in his support of a proposed takeover of his company by Dollar Tree Inc .

column4: UPDATE 2-Dollar General questions motives of Family Dollar CEO
column5: (Adds reference to attempt to seek comment from Family Dollar in paragraph 5  Icahn quote in paragraph 13)

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Dollar General questions motives of Family Dollar CEO
column5: (Corrects paragraph 6 to say Levine will remain CEO of Family Dollar  not become CEO of the combined company. Also corrects to say Levine is expected to lose his job  not that he will)

column4: San Diego Padres - PlayerWatch
column5: LHP Bobby LaFromboise was designated for assignment to make room on the 40-man roster for INF Jace Peterson  who was optioned to Triple-A El Paso. He was 1-2 with three saves and a 4.75 ERA in 58 appearances for El Paso this season.

column4: Enbridge plans Alberta Clipper pipeline boost despite U.S delays
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Aug 21 Enbridge Inc  Canada's largest pipeline company  might be able to circumvent a delay in U.S. approvals for plans to nearly double the size of its Alberta Clipper line taking oil sands crude to the Midwest  saying it can put the oil in another pipeline to cross the border.

column4: Mozambique sees $30 bln investment for 2018 LNG exports startup
column5: PEMBA  Mozambique  Aug 21 More than $30 billion will be invested initially in Mozambique's natural gas sector to build capacity to produce 20 million tonnes per year of liquefied natural gas (LNG)  with the first exports due to start in 2018  the national oil company said.

column4: Alaska voters narrowly backing tax cut for oil industry
column5: JUNEAU Alaska Alaskan voters appear to have narrowly upheld a new law that cut taxes on oil production and is worth up to $1 billion a year for companies such as ConocoPhillips  BP Plc and Exxon Mobil Corp  according to results available on Wednesday.

column4: Exclusive: Chrysler's Ram pickup may stick with steel through 2020 - sources
column5: DETROIT Chrysler Group [CHRY.UL] is planning an extensive facelift of its full-size Ram 1500 pickup in spring 2017  but has no firm plans to follow rivals General Motors and Ford Motor Co in replacing steel body panels with aluminum until a complete redesign after 2020  industry sources told Reuters.

column4: Ford tells dealers to stop selling some C-Max  Focus models
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co has told its dealers to stop test-driving and selling C-Max and Focus models produced during a week this month because of potential problems with the steering gear assembly  a notice sent to dealers on Wednesday shows.

column4: Ford tells U.S. dealers to stop selling some C-Max  Focus models
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co has told its U.S. dealers to stop test-driving and selling C-Max and Focus models produced during a week this month because of potential problems with the steering gear assembly  a notice sent to dealers on Wednesday shows.

column4: Ford tells U.S. dealers to stop selling some C-Max  Focus models
column5: DETROIT  Aug 21 Ford Motor Co has told its U.S. dealers to stop test-driving and selling C-Max and Focus models produced during a week this month because of potential problems with the steering gear assembly  a notice sent to dealers on Wednesday shows.

column4: UPDATE 1-GameStop 2nd-quarter sales beat expectations; shares rise
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 21 GameStop Corp on Thursday reported its quarterly revenue surged by 25 percent over the prior year  topping expectations  buoyed by the success of new game releases as well as solid sales of gaming hardware from Microsoft and Sony Corp.

column4: GameStop's Q2 sales beat expectations  shares climb
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 21 GameStop Corp  posted a better than expected 25 percent gain in second-quarter revenue to $1.73 billion  buoyed by the success of new game releases as well as solid sales of gaming hardware from Microsoft and Sony Corp.

column4: Gap raises forecast; to open 40 stores in India
column5: Apparel retailer Gap Inc raised its full-year profit forecast  encouraged by strong sales of its lower-priced Old Navy clothes  and said it would open 40 stores in India as part of its strategy to expand in emerging markets.

column4: UPDATE 1-Gap raises forecast; to open 40 stores in India
column5: Aug 21 Apparel retailer Gap Inc raised its full-year profit forecast  encouraged by strong sales of its lower-priced Old Navy clothes  and said it would open 40 stores in India as part of its strategy to expand in emerging markets.

column4: Gap raises forecast as 2nd-qtr profit beats estimates
column5: Aug 21 Teen apparel retailer Gap Inc  reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit and sales and raised its full-year profit forecast  helped by strong sales of its low-priced Old Navy clothes.

column4: Cadillac considers moving some functions to Manhattan
column5: DETROIT General Motors Co's  premium Cadillac group is considering expanding its offices from Detroit to Manhattan  GM said Thursday  as part of an effort to remake the brand's image and broaden its appeal outside North America under new boss Johan de Nysschen.

column4: Cadillac considers moving some functions to Manhattan
column5: DETROIT  Aug 21 General Motors Co's  premium Cadillac group is considering expanding its offices from Detroit to Manhattan  GM said Thursday  as part of an effort to remake the brand's image and broaden its appeal outside North America under new boss Johan de Nysschen.

column4: GM Russia plant to slash production for three months
column5: MOSCOW  Aug 21 General Motors Co said on Thursday it would reduce production at its plant near St Petersburg  citing a continued slowdown of the Russian auto market.

column4: Foresight wins Goldman big role in China's preferred shares deals
column5: HONG KONG As Chinese banks prepare to raise $55 billion in the country's first preferred share offers  foreign investment banks with experience in structuring such deals are ready to pounce on a potential $275 million in underwriting fees.

column4: DEALTALK-Foresight wins Goldman big role in China's preferred shares deals
column5: HONG KONG  Aug 22 As Chinese banks prepare to raise $55 billion in the country's first preferred share offers  foreign investment banks with experience in structuring such deals are ready to pounce on a potential $275 million in underwriting fees.

column4: JPMorgan  BofA to raise junior banker pay by 20 percent: sources
column5: NEW YORK JPMorgan Chase & Co and Bank of America Corp are planning to hike salaries of junior employees by at least 20  percent  people familiar with the proceedings said.

column4: Hertz investor Fir Tree says CEO 'lost credibility'
column5: BOSTON Hertz Global Holdings Inc investor Fir Tree Partners on Thursday stepped up its calls for the car rental company to replace its chief executive  saying CEO Mark Frissora "has completely lost credibility."

column4: UPDATE 1-Hertz investor Fir Tree says CEO 'lost credibility'
column5: (Adds details from statement  background on battle over Hertz)

column4: Hertz investor Fir Tree says CEO "lost credibility"
column5: BOSTON  Aug 21 Hertz Global Holdings Inc.  investor Fir Tree Partners on Thursday stepped up its calls for the car rental company to replace its chief executive  saying that the current CEO Mark Frissora "has completely lost credibility."

column4: Icahn reveals stake in Hertz  plans to push management
column5: BOSTON Billionaire investor Carl Icahn said on Wednesday that he owns an 8.5 percent stake in Hertz Global Holdings Inc and plans to pressure the rental car company's management over accounting issues and operational failures.

column4: UPDATE 1-Icahn reveals stake in Hertz  plans to push management
column5: BOSTON  Aug 20 Billionaire investor Carl Icahn said on Wednesday that he owns an 8.5 percent stake in Hertz Global Holdings Inc and plans to pressure the rental car company's management over accounting issues and operational failures.

column4: Home Depot names U.S. retail head Craig Menear as CEO
column5: Home Depot Inc named retail industry veteran Craig Menear as its chief executive  four months after he was appointed as head of the home improvement chain's U.S. retail business.

column4: Home Depot names Craig Menear CEO
column5: Aug 21 Home Depot Inc named Craig Menear its chief executive  replacing Frank Blake  who will stay on as chairman.

column4: Honda to modify Fit to boost test score  calls back 12 000 cars
column5: DETROIT The first 12 000 U.S. customers who bought the 2015 Honda Fit subcompact cars will be asked to have the vehicles retrofitted to attain top marks from the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety  Honda Motor Co  and the IIHS said Thursday.

column4: Honda to modify Fit to boost test score  calls back 12 000 cars
column5: DETROIT  Aug 21 The first 12 000 U.S. customers who bought the 2015 Honda Fit subcompact cars will be asked to have the vehicles retrofitted to attain top marks from the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety  Honda Motor Co  and the IIHS said Thursday.

column4: HSBC chairman warns Scottish independence could trigger capital flight: Telegraph
column5: Uncertainty over Scotland's currency arrangements could prompt capital flight from the country  leaving its financial system in a "parlous state " Douglas Flint  chairman of HSBC Holdings Plc  wrote in a column on Thursday in the Telegraph newspaper in Britain.

column5: Aug 21 Uncertainty over Scotland's currency arrangements could prompt capital flight from the country  leaving its financial system in a "parlous state " Douglas Flint  chairman of HSBC Holdings Plc  wrote in a column on Thursday in the Telegraph newspaper in Britain.

column4: China economy fears deepen as August HSBC flash PMI at three-month low
column5: BEIJING Growth in China's vast factory sector slowed to a three-month low in August as output and new orders moderated  a preliminary private survey showed on Thursday  heightening concerns about increasing softness in the economy.

column4: Li & Fung H1 net profit rises 16 pct
column5: HONG KONG  Aug 21 Hong Kong's Li & Fung Ltd   supplier of goods like clothing and toys to retailers such as Wal-Mart Stores Inc and Kohl's Corp  said first-half net profit rose 16 percent as it shrugged off weak U.S. retail trading.

column4: Exclusive: Lockheed  suppliers brainstorm how to lower F-35 operating costs
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp met with 90 key suppliers last week to brainstorm ways to lower the long-term cost of operating and maintaining the F-35 fighter jets from the Pentagon's current forecast of $1.02 trillion through 2065.

column4: After Russia targets McDonald's  businesses wonder who's next
column5: MOSCOW Russia Russia said on Thursday it was investigating dozens of McDonald's  restaurants  in what many businessmen said was retaliation for Western sanctions over Ukraine they fear could spread to other symbols of Western capitalism. | Video

column4: China tries five cult members for McDonald's murder
column5: BEIJING China tried five members of a banned religious group on Thursday for the murder of a woman who was beaten to death at a McDonald's restaurant after she refused to give them her telephone number when they apparently tried to recruit her.

column4: UPDATE 2-Russia extends scrutiny of McDonald's restaurants
column5: * U.S.-Russia ties soured by Ukraine crisis   (Adds McDonald's comment  checks underway in more regions)

column4: Russia making checks at McDonald's in two more regions: Ifax
column5: MOSCOW Russia's food safety watchdog is conducting checks at McDonald's restaurants in the Tatarstan region and will begin scheduled checks at its outlets in the region of Bashkortostan later this month  Interfax news agency reported on Thursday.

column4: Russia making checks at McDonald's in two more regions - Ifax
column5: MOSCOW  Aug 21 Russia's food safety watchdog is conducting checks at McDonald's restaurants in the Tatarstan region and will begin scheduled checks at its outlets in the region of Bashkortostan later this month  Interfax news agency reported on Thursday.

column4: Russia to check McDonald's restaurants in Krasnodar region
column5: MOSCOW Russian food safety watchdog Rospotrebnadzor will start conducting checks at McDonald's restaurants in the southern Krasnodar region next week  local watchdog official Irina Voronkova told Reuters.

column4: Russia to check McDonald's restaurants in Krasnodar region
column5: MOSCOW  Aug 21 Russian food safety watchdog Rospotrebnadzor will start conducting checks at McDonald's restaurants in the southern Krasnodar region next week  local watchdog official Irina Voronkova told Reuters.

column4: Russia conducts checks at McDonald's restaurants in Urals region - Itar-Tass
column5: MOSCOW  Aug 21 Russian food safety watchdog Rospotrebnadzor is conducting unscheduled checks at McDonald's restaurants in Sverdlovsk region  Itar-Tass news agency reported  citing local watchdog official Natalya Lukyantseva.

column4: ON THE MOVE-Wells Fargo hires 2 Morgan Stanley brokers with $350 mln in assets
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 21 Wells Fargo Advisors  Wells Fargo & Company's registered broker-dealer  said Thursday it recruited two brokers away from rival securities brokerage Morgan Stanley  where they managed nearly $350 million in client assets.

column4: Deutsche Bank sells North American natgas book to Morgan Stanley -source
column5: Aug 21 Duetsche Bank has sold its North American natural gas trading book to Morgan Stanley   a source familiar with the deal said on Thursday.

column4: Exclusive: Shake Shack picks JPMorgan  Morgan Stanley to lead IPO - sources
column5: NEW YORK Shake Shack  the fast-food restaurant chain that has developed a cult following for its 'Shackburgers'  'flat-top' hot dogs and eponymous shakes  has selected JPMorgan Chase & Co  and Morgan Stanley  to lead a proposed initial public offering  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: ON THE MOVE-Raymond James hires financial advisers from Morgan Stanley
column5: Aug 21 Raymond James Financial Inc said it had hired financial advisers James Switzer and Eric Cobb from Morgan Stanley.

column4: Petrovietnam seeking $1.8bln loan for Murphy Oil Malaysia stake-Basis Point
column5: HONG KONG  Aug 21 Petrovietnam is in talks with banks for a seven-year loan of up to $1.8 billion to back its bid to buy a stake in Murphy Oil Corp's Malaysian oil and gas assets  Thomson Reuters publication Basis Point reported on Wednesday  citing sources.

column4: Afghanistan gives NYT reporter 24 hours to leave country
column5: KABUL Afghanistan has given a New York Times reporter 24 hours to leave the country  accusing him of not cooperating with an investigation into his reporting  the Attorney General's office said on Wednesday.

column4: Under Armour looking to lure Durant away from Nike -ESPN.com
column5: Aug 21 Sports apparel retailer Under Armour  is looking to lure NBA most valuable player Kevin Durant away from rival Nike in a deal worth as much as $285 million over 10 years  ESPN.com reported on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Salesforce lifts forecast on strong demand for cloud software
column5: Aug 21 Salesforce.com Inc reported better-than-expected quarterly revenue  helped by an increase in demand for its web-based sales and marketing software  and raised its full-year profit and revenue forecast.

column4: FDA approves use of Eliquis to treat leg  lung clots
column5: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co and Pfizer Inc on Thursday said U.S. regulators have approved an expanded use for their Eliquis blood clot preventer  to treat blood clots in the legs and lungs.

column4: UPDATE 1-FDA approves use of Eliquis to treat leg  lung clots
column5: Aug 21 Bristol-Myers Squibb Co and Pfizer Inc on Thursday said U.S. regulators have approved an expanded use for their Eliquis blood clot preventer  to treat blood clots in the legs and lungs.

column4: FDA OKs use of Eliquis to treat leg  lung clots
column5: Aug 21 Bristol-Myers Squibb Co and Pfizer Inc on Thursday said U.S. regulators have approved an expanded use for their Eliquis blood clot preventer  to treat dangerous blood clots in the legs and lungs.

column4: Pfizer back for AstraZeneca? Year-end move seen most likely
column5: LONDON Shares in drugmaker AstraZeneca have climbed more than 7 percent this week  fueled by speculation of renewed takeover interest from Pfizer  following an abortive $118 billion (71 billion pounds) takeover attempt in May.

column4: UPDATE 1-Plains to build Cushing-to-Memphis pipeline for Valero
column5: HOUSTON  Aug 21 Plains All American Pipeline LP  will build a crude oil pipeline from its terminal at the U.S. futures hub in Cushing  Oklahoma  to Valero Energy Corp's  Tennessee refinery  helping the largest U.S. refiner cut transportation costs to tap cheap inland oil.

column4: Salesforce.com quarterly revenue rises 38 pct
column5: Aug 21 Salesforce.com Inc's quarterly revenue rose 38 percent  helped by increased demand for its web-based sales and marketing software and services.

column4: 'Jackass' star could face charges for SeaWorld sign prank
column5: SAN DIEGO  Aug 21 Steve-O  one of the stars of the TV show "Jackass " could face criminal charges after he defaced a San Diego highway sign with a green banner that left it reading: "SeaWorld Sucks " officials said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-GameStop 2nd-quarter sales beat expectations; shares rise
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 21 GameStop Corp on Thursday reported its quarterly revenue surged by 25 percent over the prior year  topping expectations  buoyed by the success of new game releases as well as solid sales of gaming hardware from Microsoft and Sony Corp.

column4: Sprint and T-Mobile offer further price discounts
column5: WASHINGTON Sprint Corp  unveiled a plan on Thursday that gives subscribers access to unlimited data for $60 a month  the industry's cheapest unlimited data offering as the carrier attempts to reverse the decline in its subscriber base.

column4: Taiwan government plans to raise $710 million from TSMC stock sale next year: sources
column5: TAIPEI Taiwan's government plans to sell 177 million shares of TSMC  next year to raise T$21.3 billion ($710 million)  part of a broader move to help repay its debts  two sources with close knowledge of the situation said on Thursday.

column4: Taiwan govt plans to raise $710 mln from TSMC stock sale next year - sources
column5: TAIPEI  Aug 21 Taiwan's government plans to sell 177 million shares of TSMC next year to raise T$21.3 billion ($710 million)  part of a broader move to help repay its debts  two sources with close knowledge of the situation said on Thursday.

column4: Toyota to cut prices of Lexus auto parts in China amid anti-trust concerns
column5: SHANGHAI Toyota Motor Corp  said on Thursday that it would cut prices of auto parts for its luxury Lexus models in China  following similar moves by its German rivals  in response to heightened regulatory scrutiny over anti-trust issues.

column4: UPDATE 1-Toyota to cut prices of Lexus auto parts in China amid anti-trust concerns
column5: SHANGHAI  Aug 21 Toyota Motor Corp said on Thursday that it would cut prices of auto parts for its luxury Lexus models in China  following similar moves by its German rivals  in response to heightened regulatory scrutiny over anti-trust issues.

column4: Toyota to cut prices of Lexus auto parts in China amid anti-trust concern
column5: SHANGHAI  Aug 21 Toyota Motor Corp said on Thursday it would cut prices of auto parts for its luxury Lexus models in China by an average 26 percent amid increasing scrutiny over anti-trust issues by the country's regulators.

column5: A federal judge in California on Thursday denied a request by Allergan Inc to expedite its civil suit claiming that Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc and Pershing Square Capital Management engaged in insider trading ahead of their bid to buy Allergan.
